conversations.content: A moment, if you would. Might you be the pactbound prince?
That's right. Who are you?
My name is Xainfried, and I come to you—
Squeeeak! Squeeeeak!
You have infant dragons! ...TWO of them!
I do, and it is my sworn responsibility to take care of them both.
Their names are Fydon and Felyx.
It's not often one stumbles upon a human raising young dragons.
Just who are you, sir?
I am an Aegis. Protecting these creatures is my solemn duty.
I have heard that name before...
They were a tribe that lived deep in the mountains and worshipped dragons.
Indeed. We attended to the dragons' every need and in return received their blessings in our daily lives.
But that is all in the past. In the end, my people fell in battle against another, hostile tribe.
...Even our dragons fell.
The only survivors of the conflict were myself and the two dragons who now accompany me.
We've been wandering the land together ever since.
I'm very sorry to hear that. But what brings you here?
No matter where I go, I've yet to find a place where these two will be able to live in safety.
However, during my travels, I heard rumor of a pactbound prince who lives alongside dragons in peace.
And you thought that man would be able to shelter your charges from harm?
Correct. I know it is a great deal to ask, but would you let us stay here? Or just them, if I am too large a burden.
All of you are welcome here.
I'm deeply grateful for your kindness.
Can you take Fydon and Felyx to the Dragon's Roost, Cleo?
If it's not too much to ask, might you permit me to stay with them as well?
Huh?
Fydon and Felyx get lonely at night if I'm not with them.
Squeeeak... Squeeeak!
Wow. That's actually adorable. Think we can make this work, Cleo?
I'll prepare a room in the castle for three.
Oh, thank you so much!
Please, it's no trouble at all. Welcome to the Halidom, Xainfried.
I hope to repay this kindness someday.
...Did you hear that, you two? You'll get a good night's sleep tonight!
Squeeeak! Squeeeak!
So we preserve the freshwater fish in salt for three days and nights, fillet it thinly, then add seven different spices.
You're terribly skilled at this—and your knife skills are almost beyond compare.
This is a dish I've made since I lived in the mountains. It is quite familiar to me.
Something smells good...
No snacking before dinner, Euden.
Fiiine.
...Hmm? Oh, hello, Xainfried. I didn't expect to find you here.
Apologies for taking up your kitchen.
He's preparing food for Fydon and Felyx, and I'm watching out of curiosity.
Right then. The next step is to mix in some bellathorna...
Bellathorna? That's quite poisonous.
To humans, yes, but it's essential for the healthy growth of dragons.
They're not exactly fond of it, though.
Wow. You really do know everything about raising dragons.
I know enough to ensure they grow up healthy and happy.
I want them to become fine adult dragons like their parents were one day.
Heh. You're almost like their father.
Their...father? Hmm. I've never thought of it that way before.
Caring for dragons is the duty of our tribe.
I was taught that it was something that should be done unquestioningly, without putting personal feelings into the equation.
Still... Their father...
What do you think it means to be a father, Euden?
I'm probably not the best person to ask, to be honest.
But I suppose it's about being a good role model for your children.
Hmm... A role model...
Squeak! Squeak! Squeeeeeeak!
Enough, you two! Slow down and chew! It's not going to run away from you.
They seem to be enjoying your food.
Yet I notice they're eating around the bellathorna.
Fydon! Felyx! Finish every bite, now! You can't grow up big and strong if you don't eat it all.
Squeeeeeeeak...
Here. Watch me.
Uhhh, Xainfried? What are you do—
This is good for you! Watch.
H-hold on! That is a poisonous herb! We literally JUST discussed this!
Spit it out at once!
Mmm... Yummy! Now eat up, you two.
Squeeeak! *chomp* *snorf*
That's the spirit! Keep eating it so you can both grow up big and stro— GYAAAACK!
Cleo, quick! Get an antidote or a curing potion or something!
The bellathorna'sh poishon...merely numbsh she body... It'sh not lethal...
I'll just resht...for a schecond... and it should go awaysh...
That was a really stupid thing to do, Xainfried.
Brrrr! *smack smack* Ah, there we are. ...Yes, I suppose you're correct.
But their real parents aren't in this world anymore.
Which means I must serve as a role model in their stead.
Xainfried and I are heading out to take care of those fiends.
Very well. I'll take care of Fydon and Felyx in the meantime.
Thank you. Be good, you two— and stay here!
Squeak! Squeeeeak!
Fydon! Felyx! It's time for lunch!
...Fydon? Felyx? Where are you?
Hah!
You took them all out in a single blow...
You Aegis are a really impressive bunch.
These fiends are nothing. I fought ones twice as strong when I lived in the mountains.
But never mind these small fry—we need to hurry and find their leader.
If I take too long to come back, my dragons will start getting uneasy.
Squeeeeeeak!
...Er, I may be hearing things, but I feel like that was Fydon and Felyx.
They couldn't...
Squeak! Squeak!
You followed me? Bad dragons! Bad!
Huh. Do we need to take them back to the castle and come back later?
Raaaaaaaagh!
That option is off the table, I fear.
That's the leader! Ugh, why did it have to  show up now?
Leave this to me.
I leave Fydon and Felyx in your care, Euden.
Hraaaaaah!
Nnngh... This one's tough...
Squeak! Squeak!
I can't lose a battle while those two are watching me! Yaaaah!
You did it!
Our work here is complete. Let's get back to the castle.
Whew... Just a little farther now.
Euden, I'm sorry for the trouble those two caused today.
Oh, don't worry about it.
Still, I can't believe they actually followed us all that way.
Nor can I, especially as I told them to stay put and wait for me to return.
Maybe they wanted to see their father in all his action-hero glory.
Squeak! Squeak!
Do you think? That's actually a little embarrassing...
You really seemed to release your true strength when they were watching you.
Fyyyyydon! Feeeeelyx! Where aaare you?!
Was that Elly? She must not know the dragons are here with us.
I will have to apologize to her, as well. Atoning for a child's mistakes is the duty of their parent, after all.
Your Highness! The castle has come under attack by a group of bandits!
What?!
They appear to be after the young dragons Felyx and Fydon. But how did they even know they were here?!
Bring me to these rogues—I will choke the very life out of them with my own hands!
Ranzal and the others are holding them off at the front gate! Hurry!
Oi! Looks like we found some'a the castle residents, so we did!
No! They're already inside the castle!
Bwa ha ha! Yer friends at the gate ain't too bright. They fell for our little distraction 'ook, line, and sinker!
Now 'and over them kid dragons, or I start crackin' skulls.
What would you even want with them? I can't see ruffians such as you wanting to raise them as your own.
Raise 'em? Are ya daft? I ain't cut out to play nursemaid for a bunch'a moppets!
We'll either sell 'em off to some rich bloke or dice 'em up and use the bits what to make fancy medicines.
You monsters...
I'm guessing you're fairly confident in your strength if you've chosen to call us out.
But that was your error, for the moment I saw you, your fate was sealed. Today, you die on my lance.
Bwa ha ha! Lookit this one, boys! Spoilin' for a fight, 'e is! ...Get 'em!
Get ready, Elly!
Oh, I am.
Cor! We got twice their numbers, so 'ow in the 'ell they beatin' us?!
Still, we oughta be juuust about...
Oi! We got them two dragons! Let's get outta here!
Damn! This was nothing but a diversion!
SQUEEEEEAK!
Release them at once!
Eh? You say somethin'?!
GRAAAAAAGH!
Gya! This one 'ere's a damn monster!
It's like fightin' 10 men at once, it is! Gyaaaaa!
He...he killed them all. By HIMSELF.
I barely had time to process what was happening.
*pant* Are you both well?
Squeak! Squeak!
Oi! Nobody makes a fool of us bandits and gets away with it! DIIIIIE!
Xainfried! Behind you!
SQUEAK! SQUEAK!
Gaaah! Them little dragons're... Graaaagh!
Incredible...
Hey! We drove back all the guys at the gates and... Uh...
Huh. That's a lot'a dead bandits. You guys were busy.
That's good work considerin' there were only three of ya back here.
Five. Fydon and Felyx helped as well.
Squeak! Squeak!
It seems my time protecting you may be coming to a close...
Graaaaaaaaah!
Whew! That's the last of them. Now the people here should be able to live in peace once more.
The fiends seem to be getting ever more ferocious lately.
Agreed. I find myself having to shapeshift with increasing frequency these days.
Speaking of which, might I ask you  something, Euden?
Sure. Go ahead.
Fydon and Felyx are yet children.
But eventually, they will grow into adults that possess immeasurable power.
When that happens, do you intend to form a pact with them?
I'm not considering that at the moment.
At the moment?
Well, there's a chance we're going to keep running up against ever stronger foes.
When that happens, I'm going to need the strength of as many dragons as I can convince to lend me their aid.
So if Fydon and Felyx want to help me, I would be grateful to have their support.
But that decision is entirely up to them.
I see...
Haaaah!
Out training, Xainfried?
Indeed.
I've never seen you training before. Why the sudden interest?
Do you remember when I told you how my people were annihilated by a hostile tribe?
They wiped out your people as well as all of your dragons, yes? Well, except for your two, of course.
This tribe caught us off guard by launching a surprise attack against the settlement.
When that happened, the parents of Felyx and Fydon gave their lives fighting for us.
That desire—that need to save those who you love... I have never seen its like before or since.
But it's clear that my dragon charges have inherited it.
When they fought to save me from the bandits, I saw the same look in their eyes that I saw in their parents'.
And you think they'll grow up wanting to protect others?
Yes. And when that happens, I must be there to fight at their side.
Which means I must become even stronger than I am now.
This is my duty as an Aegis.
I see. Well, if I can help with anything, make sure to let me know.
If ever you find yourself in need of more strength, Euden, I'd be happy if you formed a pact with them.
I'm sure they would love nothing more than to join with someone who also fights for the good of others.
And if this happens, I will also fight to protect their new master.
Thank you, Xainfried.
Although if you ask me, there's more influence here than just what comes from their biological parents.
What do you mean?
Children grow up watching their parents— and learning from them.
I'm guessing Fydon and Felyx both admire the way you fight.
Mmm. I find that thought...embarrassing.
